page.title: 03 SITUATION AND GEOLOGY PART1
page.content: The central settlement of the area is Binfield Heath, which is a scattered hamlet divided between the parishes of Eye & Dunsden and Shiplake in Oxfordshire, which are almost entirely agricultural in character. It stands on one of the south-eastern foothills of the Chilterns and is approximately contained by the three-hundred-foot contour, with a maximum altitude of three hundred and thirty seven feet above sea-level at the top of Lee Hill above Dunsden Green. The view,which extends to a skyline of the Hampshire hills in the south, embraces the Thames Valley from beyond Reading in the west to Windsor in the east, the Round Tower of the Castle being visible on a clear day from a point near Hampstead Farm Cottages at a distance of fourteen miles.
